title: Who is the strongest champion lore wise?

embed.description: Years of conversation fill a ton of digital pages, and we've kept all of it accessible to browse or copy over. Whether you're looking for reveal articles for older champions, or the first time that Rammus rolled into an "OK" thread, or anything in between, you can find it here.

body: i wanted to bring this back as nobody truly concluded who is the strongest champion lore wise from the discussion lux chogath wukong annie ryze xerath jax nasus and a few others were all ranked very highly although i think aatrox is the strongest personally as in his lore he is one of a very small amount of a very powerful race and he was famed as being able to WIN ANY BATTLE with a price to be had which makes me think that he could win any battle he encounters not to mention he had ressurection so i want to see everybody elses opinions on this

replies.body: {{champion:45}} opens black holes and corrupts cosmic energy

I've never understood why people constantly say he can summon black holes.  His abilities are named after space terms, yes, one of them  has to do with a black hole (maybe more, but whatever I don't remember all the names) but nothing he does is remotely similar to black holes at all.

Players don't know much about champions, so we use abilities to help understand a champion's lore.

Besides, it's about  lore not gameplay, his E does barely anything close to a black hole gamewise, but it could hint that he can summon black holes in "reality" in Runeterra

Or... it could indicate that he's just trying to be flashy. I mean, if he was actually dropping Dark Matter, Runeterra would be nonexistant. Chances are far more likely that he  just shoots around dark power, and calls it by big names to scare people. Which would be very Veigar like too.

It had been discussed on another site,who could be omnipotent. It's against {{champion:134}}  & {{champion:101}} mostly,some mentioned {{champion:432}}  ,but it was during his release confirmed he isn't omnipotent.

He was lucky when he summoned Kogmaw and the Voidlings... but imagine if he opens a portal and a creature like {{champion:421}}  or {{champion:121}}  appears, I'm pretty sure that those creatures would eat him instead of helping him.

Kha'Zix is actually on good terms with Malzahar, so he wouldn't be worried. The only one he may be worried about is Rek'Sai since she doesn't seem to have any intelligence, though due to being touched by the Void (Old) Gods, Malzahar would probably be fine even if she was summoned in his presence.

Basically since Malzahar  is the beacon for the Void, he has been the reason all of the Voidborn have been summoned.

>"Even now, something dark stirs in Icathia, perverting the summoning rituals of the League to allow the presence of Cho'Gath."

This was most likely Malzahar's first work.

You are assuming those things, Chogath was summoned by summoners of the League (old lore, has not been changed yet) and not Malzahar. 

The creatures of the void can enter to Runeterra without help of him, just look at {{champion:161}} lore and {{champion:121}}, they weren't helped by Malzahar at all.  In fact, when Velkoz appeared in Runeterra, he was alongside other creatures of the Void, and he killed them because they were interfering with his "plans".

Other aggressive creatures of the Void, like Velkoz or Reksai, would kill and eat a random lesser creature that opened a "door" for them. 

The fact is, that he cant expect that all the void creatures will be friendly with him because he is "allied" of them... As someone said "That's like expecting the lion not to eat you because you didn't eat him"

Cho'Gath was summoned by summoners in error, something from Icathia stirred causing the summoning to be perverted (they didn't want to summoner Cho'Gath). There have only been two individuals to stir Icathia, Kassadin and Malzahar, my money is it was Malzahar, at the time of his rebirth.

>The creatures of the void can enter to Runeterra without help of him

Kog'Maw's lore disagrees with you

>When the prophet Malzahar was reborn in Icathia, he was led there by an ominous voice which thereafter anchored itself to his psyche. From within, this voice bestowed upon him terrible purpose, and though Malzahar was no longer tormented by its call, the voice did not cease its unrelenting summons. This baleful beacon's gentle flicker - now fastened to Runeterra - drew forth a putrid beast that ambled across a threshold it did not understand, widening a fissure between spaces which were never meant to meet.

When Malzahar was touched and reborn, he became the beacon and focus of all Voidborn entering into Valoran. This is why Kassadin has been trying to kill him, and why Malzahar wants to recruit him. If Kassadin can break the beacon, the Voidborn need a new anchor, while if Malzahar can have Kassadin join him, their beacon would be that much stronger.

>Other aggressive creatures of the Void, like Velkoz or Reksai, would kill and eat a random lesser creature that opened a "door" for them.

>The fact is, that he cant expect that all the void creatures will be friendly with him because he is "allied" of them... As someone said "That's like expecting the lion not to eat you because you didn't eat him"

It less, not expecting a lion to eat you, instead, it would be like expecting the Spawn of Cthulhu not to attack you because Cthulhu himself has chosen you to do his will.
These aren't some animals (mostly) from another planet, these are eldritch abominations, and their god has a plan involving Malzahar, and you can bet your right hand that they do not want to piss it off and attack Malzahar. Would you want to knowingly bite the hand of the god that opened the door for you through a prophet?

I would argue that even the more animalistic Voidborn would not attack Malzahar to avoid the wrath of their god, even in another plane, or they can feel it through Malzahar.

Perhaps not a god, but something powerful enough to reach through the veil and empower Malzahar, something far more powerful than any of the Voidborn we have ever seen so far. Something they would not wish to anger.

We also don't know what the Zz'Rot Portal is. It may may be something of Malzahar's creation to summon more Voidborn (the Zz'Rot?) or if Zz'Rot is the name of the supremely powerful Voidborn that touched Malzahar.

It could be a lie, though there is no evidence to say that, and even Kassadin thinks there is an invasion, which he believes is his purpose to stop.

There is no evidence of a portal in Icathia, just that the inhabitants learned ancient arts relating to the Void and that Kassadin was almost consumed by the power of the location.

>secrets that made him quake with fear at the visions of things to come that were thrust upon him. The power of the place threatened to consume him forever, but Kassadin took the only route available to him in order to survive - he let the Void inside him.

Icathia seems to be described as a resonating area with the Void, similar to many Lovecraft stories where a location is attuned to the old gods and their realms.

Perhaps Malzahar is brainwashed, though I don't think so. Malzahar seems to have seen absolute despair and embraced it, almost similar in a way how Kassadin embraced the Void in order to survive it.

Rek'Sai has possibility be in Shurima before Malzahar, though we don't know how long Malzahar has been the Prophet of the Void. We know he has a massive cult dedicated to bringing forth the Void, which isn't something that happens overnight. It could go one way or the other. Being the most primal, and have been in the area for over a decade, Rek'Sai may be the first of the Voidborn to enter the world.

The best part of the Lovecraft mythos is what the characters are told by the old ones are not lies. Just like Malzahar, they are told the most horrible thing, the truth, and it breaks them.
